intro: Parosela amoena, commonly known as the elegant parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a subtle beauty to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
